task.title: Creating the cluster in standby mode

taskbody.context: Perform this procedure to create the high-availability cluster in standby mode.

step.cmd: Log in to the primary node .

step.stepresult: When prompted, enter the password of the hacluster account.

step.cmd: Generate and synchronize an initial (empty) cluster definition.

stepxmp.codeblock: pcs cluster setup --name serviced-ha \ Primary-Public-Name Secondary-Public-Name

step.cmd: Start the PCS management agents on both nodes in the cluster.
step.info: The cluster definition is empty, so starting the cluster management agents has no side effects.
step.stepresult: The cluster management agents start, on both nodes.
The expected result is Online, for both nodes.

step.cmd: Put the cluster in standby mode.
step.info: Pacemaker begins monitoring and managing the different resources as they are defined, which can cause problems; standby mode prevents the problems.

step.cmd: Configure cluster services to start when the node starts.
step.info: For more information about cluster startup options, refer to the Pacemaker documentation.

stepxmp.codeblock: systemctl enable corosync; systemctl enable pacemaker

step.cmd: Replicate the configuration on the secondary node.

substep.cmd: In a separate window, log in to the secondary node .
Configure cluster services to start when the node starts.

stepxmp.codeblock: systemctl enable corosync; systemctl enable pacemaker
